body_html:
I've made the equivalent change to TensorFlow's workspace.bzl so it should now pick up the version of nsync that will work for you. (The sha256 is different (839fcc53ff9be58218ed55397deb3f8376a1444e), because I made another change to nsync, unrelated to s390x support, but it includes the change you need.)
…
On 24 October 2017 at 08:08, Nayana Thorat ***@***.***> wrote: @m3bm3b <https://github.com/m3bm3b> I could build and verify nsync code on s390x platform as C++11 as well as C. (Using steps that you have mentioned in your previous comment) As C++11: cp -r builds/x86_64.linux.c++11 builds/s390x.linux.c++11 cd builds/s390x.linux.c++11 make depend test As C: mkdir builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc sed 's,x86_64,s390x,g' builds/x86_64.linux.old_gcc/Makefile > builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc/Makefile touch builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc/dependfile cd builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc make depend test Also, could verify using bazel test :all as well. @gunan <https://github.com/gunan> I could build Tensorflow master on s390x by updating Tensorflow workspace.bzl with nsync commit id as : e14acb6027eca0d7eb5044d70bc9879acbedb727. Should I go ahead and raise a PR for the same? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#13777 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJsp2Znoy6goii3Ye1EBFTb9oQO8_XWTks5svf1egaJpZM4P70PT> .
body_text:
I've made the equivalent change to TensorFlow's workspace.bzl
so it should now pick up the version of nsync that will work for you.
(The sha256 is different (839fcc53ff9be58218ed55397deb3f8376a1444e),
because I made another change to
nsync, unrelated to s390x support, but it includes the change you need.)
…
On 24 October 2017 at 08:08, Nayana Thorat ***@***.***> wrote:
 @m3bm3b <https://github.com/m3bm3b> I could build and verify nsync code
 on s390x platform as C++11 as well as C.
 (Using steps that you have mentioned in your previous comment)

 As C++11:

 cp -r builds/x86_64.linux.c++11 builds/s390x.linux.c++11
 cd builds/s390x.linux.c++11
 make depend test

 As C:

 mkdir builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc
 sed 's,x86_64,s390x,g' builds/x86_64.linux.old_gcc/Makefile > builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc/Makefile
 touch builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc/dependfile
 cd builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc
 make depend test

 Also, could verify using bazel test :all as well.

 @gunan <https://github.com/gunan> I could build Tensorflow master on
 s390x by updating Tensorflow workspace.bzl with nsync commit id as :
 e14acb6027eca0d7eb5044d70bc9879acbedb727. Should I go ahead and raise a
 PR for the same?

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#13777 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJsp2Znoy6goii3Ye1EBFTb9oQO8_XWTks5svf1egaJpZM4P70PT>
 .
body:
I've made the equivalent change to TensorFlow's workspace.bzl
so it should now pick up the version of nsync that will work for you.
(The sha256 is different (839fcc53ff9be58218ed55397deb3f8376a1444e),
because I made another change to
nsync, unrelated to s390x support, but it includes the change you need.)


On 24 October 2017 at 08:08, Nayana Thorat <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @m3bm3b <https://github.com/m3bm3b> I could build and verify nsync code
> on s390x platform as C++11 as well as C.
> (Using steps that you have mentioned in your previous comment)
>
> As C++11:
>
> cp -r builds/x86_64.linux.c++11 builds/s390x.linux.c++11
> cd builds/s390x.linux.c++11
> make depend test
>
> As C:
>
> mkdir builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc
> sed 's,x86_64,s390x,g' builds/x86_64.linux.old_gcc/Makefile > builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc/Makefile
> touch builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc/dependfile
> cd builds/s390x.linux.old_gcc
> make depend test
>
> Also, could verify using bazel test :all as well.
>
> @gunan <https://github.com/gunan> I could build Tensorflow master on
> s390x by updating Tensorflow workspace.bzl with nsync commit id as :
> e14acb6027eca0d7eb5044d70bc9879acbedb727. Should I go ahead and raise a
> PR for the same?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/13777#issuecomment-339021966>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJsp2Znoy6goii3Ye1EBFTb9oQO8_XWTks5svf1egaJpZM4P70PT>
> .
